children.subject: Good question! In order to accommodate the changes with the bcourse online section, we are allowing Academic Interns to skip the first half hour of lab. We usually use this time for discussion/review of the previous lecture. All this and more will be discussed at the orientation next week:)
You are very welcome:) Hope to see you there!
Is the lab for CS 88 only 1.5 hrs long? I thought it is 2 hrs. Thank you

history.content:
Hello!

 

Hope you’re enjoying the last bit of summer. We're looking for students who earned a B or higher in CS88 or CS61a, are passionate about the course, and have the potential to become tutors and UGSIs in future semesters.

 

Deadline for interest form: Tuesday, 9/3 at 11:59pm

Orientation: Thursday, 9/5 at 5pm - 6:30pm

First lab with Academic Interns: Friday 9/6

 

Academic Interns will work for 3 hrs/week. The breakdown of the 3 hours consists of:

- 1 hour of preparation (e.g. doing the weekly lab ahead of time, consulting with the (U)GSI, etc.)

- 1.5 hours of assisting in lab

- 0.5 hour for pedagogy practice/reflection a week (online in bCourses)

 

Please note that starting this Fall, the EECS department is also requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in mandatory 1-unit bCourses online section (20-30 minute per week for reflections + pedagogy support).

There will be an EECS-wide Academic Intern Orientation (it will be postponed from the original date stated/TBD).

3 hr/week translates to 1 P/NP teaching unit 

Fill out a non-binding interest form here:) http://bit.ly/88AIFall19Form

Join our Piazza @ bit.ly/88AIPiazza

  

If you have any questions, feel free to send them to Amir Shahatit (ashahatit@berkeley.edu)
